New Zealand Herald https://www.nzherald.co.nz New Zealand Herald News Feed 2024 年 1 月 19 日星期五 06:15:54 +0000 zh 1每小时1
Armed robber Man Lim, who targeted Auckland and Kāpiti Coast banks, sentenced to home detention https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/armed-robber-man-lim-who-targeted-auckland-and-kapiti-coast-banks-sentenced-to-home-detention/WPBPZDUDINDC3GSGWPQ6GIWCS4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/armed-robber-man-lim-who-targeted-auckland-and-kapiti-coast-banks-sentenced-to-home-detention/WPBPZDUDINDC3GSGWPQ6GIWCS4/ Craig KapitanIt's very unusual for such cases to not result in imprisonment, the judge acknowledged. Fri, 19 Jan 2024 06:00:00 +0000 Police previously released this CCTV still of a person robbing an ASB bank branch at Glenfield Mall in July 2022. Man Lim later pleaded guilty to the heist.
World shearing record smashed near Dannevirke https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/world-shearing-record-smashed-near-dannevirke/7VBSRZDXBRFTBNQAWWKCH7VQNI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/world-shearing-record-smashed-near-dannevirke/7VBSRZDXBRFTBNQAWWKCH7VQNI/ Doug LaingThe target was 1611 - it was broken with more than half an hour to go. Fri, 19 Jan 2024 05:11:59 +0000 World record shearing at Pohuetai, near Dannevirke, with shearers (from left) Flynn Harvey, Hemi Braddick and Ray Kinsman on their way to a new mark on Thursday.
Tribal Huk leader Jamie Pink agrees to hand over $300,000 gained from criminal activity https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/tribal-huk-leader-jamie-pink-agrees-to-hand-over-300000-gained-from-criminal-activity/VX5U7K3Z2ZAR7BS6DBQKJPIWLM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/tribal-huk-leader-jamie-pink-agrees-to-hand-over-300000-gained-from-criminal-activity/VX5U7K3Z2ZAR7BS6DBQKJPIWLM/ Ric StevensPolice had sought $1.6 million which they estimated Pink netted through gang life. Fri, 19 Jan 2024 05:00:00 +0000 Jamie Pink was sentenced to seven years and four months in prison in 2020. Photo / NZME
Kitty’s condition worst vet had ever seen: Christchurch man gets home detention over cat’s fractures https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/kittys-condition-worst-vet-had-ever-seen-christchurch-man-gets-home-detention-over-cats-fractures/LSBYC7FSFFDDNC7CHA6SLO66TE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/kittys-condition-worst-vet-had-ever-seen-christchurch-man-gets-home-detention-over-cats-fractures/LSBYC7FSFFDDNC7CHA6SLO66TE/ Raphael FranksThe cat was found very thin, with blood coming from its mouth and covered in faeces. Fri, 19 Jan 2024 04:43:49 +0000 In March 2021, the cat, named Vendetta, was normal and healthy, the SPCA said. By August, the owner’s flatmate noticed it looked visibly thin and “as though she had been run over”, the SPCA said. Photo / SPCA
Passenger in fatal Hawke’s Bay crash highlights dangerous intersectionhttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/passenger-of-fatal-hawkes-bay-crash-highlights-dangerous-intersection/UVAUZESSHFH5BPFKEBEIRVZ73Y/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/passenger-of-fatal-hawkes-bay-crash-highlights-dangerous-intersection/UVAUZESSHFH5BPFKEBEIRVZ73Y/ James PocockMargareta Dovgal was in the front seat when the crash that killed her friend occurred. Fri, 19 Jan 2024 04:30:00 +0000 Canadian friends Helen Poon and Margareta Dovgal were travelling New Zealand together when tragedy struck and Poon died following a crash. Dovgal says she is still afraid to get into cars. Photo / Margareta Dovgal
Man wins fight with NZTA over ‘offensive’ licence plate with help from David Seymour, Simeon Brown https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/man-wins-fight-with-nzta-over-offective-licence-plate-with-help-from-david-seymour-simeon-brown/MYBI6HV7AZAONF6H5KYM42SWKE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/politics/man-wins-fight-with-nzta-over-offective-licence-plate-with-help-from-david-seymour-simeon-brown/MYBI6HV7AZAONF6H5KYM42SWKE/ Adam PearseThe 'balls' were in the Transport Minister's court, according to Seymour. Fri, 19 Jan 2024 04:08:30 +0000 A man won a battle with NZTA over his NUTSAX licence plates. Photo / Supplied
Act leader David Seymour: Why a conversation on Te Tiriti o Waitangi is important for our nation https://www.nzherald.co.nz/kahu/act-leader-david-seymour-why-a-conversation-on-te-tiriti-o-waitangi-is-important-for-our-nation/IY4IMUEBEJDOXKG3HAHUJS3HAY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/kahu/act-leader-david-seymour-why-a-conversation-on-te-tiriti-o-waitangi-is-important-for-our-nation/IY4IMUEBEJDOXKG3HAHUJS3HAY/ Act Leader David SeymourOpinion: Act leader on why it's important to discuss the principles of the Treaty. Water safety: New rescue equipment to help stop out-of-hours drownings https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/water-safety-new-rescue-equipment-to-help-stop-out-of-hours-drownings/OUFHJHTXPRBLFNY2OMQGFGKCPE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/water-safety-new-rescue-equipment-to-help-stop-out-of-hours-drownings/OUFHJHTXPRBLFNY2OMQGFGKCPE/ Denise PiperThe move recognises that not everyone swims while lifeguards are available. Fri, 19 Jan 2024 03:00:00 +0000 Locals enjoying the water at Ocean Beach, Whangārei Heads are, from left, Grace Farrier, Ella Farrier, Elsa Buckley, Faith Allen, Tommy Earl and Reon Morrison. They agree public rescue equipment should be available when lifeguards are not there. Photo / Denise Piper

KiwiRail to urgently inspect Wellington rail lines https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/kiwirail-to-urgently-inspect-wellington-rail-lines/VKHKJFI6CVBANKRTFLNMNQWFRQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/kiwirail-to-urgently-inspect-wellington-rail-lines/VKHKJFI6CVBANKRTFLNMNQWFRQ/ Georgina CampbellHutt Valley, Melling and Wairarapa lines will close next week during off-peak times.
